column4: Is anyone getting .xsession-errors after a breezy (clean) install?
what driver did you use for xserver?
its makes no difference if I use nv or (ubuntu) Nvidia
what video card do you have?
this is my post on ubuntu forums (I have a geforce 5200) http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=83486
have you tried using the vesa driver instead of the nvidia specific one, just to see if it works that way?
you won't get any acceleration, but that might help diagnose
that is (I assume) the default driver after a fresh install and checked 3 times the xsession-errors before anything
Have ya tried a different video card?
I have not...it worked with hoary I think....have you ever seen this before?
try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
and select the vesa driver specifically.
the thing is with nvidia glx installed I can run glxgears fine with 3K fps and I'm logging in fine and getting on the net fine...I just dont understand what I means
so it works fine, just gives an error that doesn't seem to come from a problem that affects you
well true...I am just curious as to what it means
I honestly have no clue, I'm not sure
thanks
sorry I coudn't help more
thanks for the alt suggestions...I can't find anyone who knows what it means..no one
UTSL... (google if it you must)
oh I spend hours today at work..I found references on the ubuntu bugs and some others, but no one knows what it means
